other_tests.findings: Lobulated, smooth, exophytic mass located approximately 2 cm above the carina, producing 80% obstruction of the tracheal lumen.

The tumor involved the full thickness of the tracheal wall, with areas of strong S100 positivity and negative staining for more specific melanocytic markers, indicating a low-grade malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumor.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Postoperative surveillance bronchoscopy at 8 weeks demonstrated a well-healed anastomosis.

other_tests.findings: The neoplasm showed infiltrative patterns with vascular invasion and negative tracheal margins after resection.
